Solar panels: Solar panels can be installed on buildings and homes to capture sunlight and convert it into electricity. This can be used to power homes, buildings, and even vehicles.
Sun-tracking mirrors: Sun-tracking mirrors can be used to focus sunlight onto a specific area, such as a greenhouse or garden. This can help plants grow and produce food, even in cloudy weather.
Artificial lighting: Artificial lighting can be used to simulate sunlight in cloudy weather. This can be done using LED lights or other types of lighting.
Solar water heating: Solar water heating systems can be used to heat water using sunlight. This can be especially useful in cloudy weather, as it can help reduce energy costs.
Solar-powered vehicles: Solar-powered vehicles can be used to generate electricity using sunlight. This can be especially useful in cloudy weather, as it can help reduce reliance on fossil fuels.
